content:
er, this premise also is subject to moral-relevance problems: the
connection between the biological and the moral is merely assumed. It is
hard to think of a good argumentfor such a connection. If one wishes to con-
sider the category of “human” a moral category, as some people find it plau-
sible to do in other contexts, then one is left with no way of showing that the
fetus is fully human without begging the question. Thus, the classic anti-
abortion argument appears subject to fatal difficult
